alert.note: Alert for Cuyahoga; Lorain (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 23 at 9:36PM EDT until August 24 at 2:30AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cleveland has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Lorain County in north central Ohio... Central Cuyahoga County in northeastern Ohio... * Until 230 AM EDT. * At 936 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 3.0 inches of rain have fallen. Heavy rain will move back into the area with additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2.0 inches possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. Several roads are flooded and water rescues have been reported. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cleveland, Lorain, Elyria, Vermilion, Parma, Lakewood, Cleveland Heights, Westlake, North Ridgeville, Solon, Avon Lake, Warrensville Heights, Amherst, Highland Hills, North Olmsted, Garfield Heights, Shaker Heights, Maple Heights, South Euclid and Avon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
